Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Hi! If your funds were locked in a failed swap you'll get it back eventually. Please note that if you're on iOS you need to keep the app opened / screen turned on for some time (mm2 can't work on this OS in background yet but it'll be improved in one of the coming updates)

Author: ca333#0118
Content: for android we can certainly implement a "silent sound" - for iOS we simply can't. However, we can work out a sound/format that isn't annoying. Maybe being able to chose the sound will be an improvement: "Female with irish accents" vs. "Male with scotch accent", "Beeps", etc.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: a beep every minute would still be less annoying than a continuous sound

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you cant have a very low volume (close to inaudible) sound on iOs?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: you can - but the goal is to get the app approval from apple - so we had to declare the application as an app which needs sound-notifications (key-feature) since that is one of the few options we had to be able to keep the app running in the background. If there is no sound it will be interpreted as a bypass of the "no app can run in the background" rule - and that would bring us back to the old situation.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: _so glad he sacked his iphone_

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Sounds above some frequency are not heard by adults (or very rarely). Sth above 20 kHz

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: only your dogs will go crazy üòÑ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can you have sounds for some aspects that are normal, and just have a keep alive "sound" that is very low volume

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 24khz at the lowest volume that is still a notification would indeed not be heard by most people

Author: ca333#0118
Content: the "mute" config setting basically sets the volume to a very low level where it still can be heard minimally - and that "still can be heard" is very essential for the way we presented the DEX app to apple.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, i understand apple can have some strict rules

Author: ca333#0118
Content: our plan B would be a VOIP integration - basically a OTC feature so that DEX clients can have VOIP calls with each other based on pubkey. But this would be an overkill at this stage since the sound solution seems to work well so far...

Author: ca333#0118
Content: (VOIP apps are another classification that allows execution of background process on iOS)

Author: ca333#0118
Content: yea - Apple has some strict rules. The reason is that otherwise apps could drain the battery and let it look like poor apple device/tech...
